clauses.question: 1. What process should the Government use to set a new emissions reduction target in legislation?
clauses.answer: The Government sets a 2050 target in legislation now
clauses.notes: We should not be leaving it up to a Commission, competent though they may be. Everyone has to own the goal.

clauses.question: 2. If the Government sets a 2050 target now, which is the best target for New Zealand?
clauses.answer: Net Zero Emissions - Net zero emissions across all greenhouse gases by 2050
clauses.notes:
I considered voting for option 2 and realise it is different for methane. I also acknowledge that all ruminant animals emit methane so I
 know this must be taken into account. However our farming industry needs huge change and we must rely less on exporting animal

 flesh and milk powder and more on growing our own and eating it. I know this has consequences for GDP measuring, but we need a
 new way of measuring our well being. If we eat what we grow it doesn't go into GDP yet we are better off. That is the enigma we need
 to face properly and belatedly.

clauses.question: 3. How should New Zealand meet its targets?
clauses.notes: I have no idea how to answer this sorry.

clauses.question: 4. Should the Zero Carbon Bill allow the 2050 target to be revised if circumstances change?
5. The Government proposes that three emissions budgets of five years each (i.e. covering the next 15 years) be in place at any given time. Do you agree with this proposal?
6. Should the Government be able to alter the last emissions budget (i.e. furthest into the future)?
clauses.answer: No - emissions budgets should not be able to be changed
clauses.notes:
It should not be changed by an incoming government, but the government will still need the country's mandate. Maybe a
 referendum, perhaps a binding one.

clauses.question: 9. Should the Zero Carbon Bill require Governments to set out plans within a certain timeframe to achieve the emissions budgets?
10. What are the most important issues for the Government to consider in setting plans to meet budgets? For example, who do we need to work with, what else needs to be considered?
clauses.notes:
Maybe meetings countrywide in homes should work on this with a wide range of parties present and special facilitators. There was

such an exercise about 40 years ago.

clauses.question: 11. The Government has proposed that the Climate Change Commission advises on and monitors New Zealand's progress towards its goals. Do you agree with these functions? See p42 Our Climate Your Say
14. Do you think the Zero Carbon Bill should cover adapting to climate change?
clauses.notes:
All the expense seems to fall on local authorities and electing members who favour mitigation and leaving certain flood prone roads,
and not rebuilding sea walls is critical. Commission should be involved in pubic information about council choices.

clauses.question: 16. Should we explore setting up a targeted adaptation reporting power that could see some organisations share information on their exposure to climate change risks?
clauses.notes: Risk management authority to support local authorities.
